HTMLTextAreaElementSetRangeText.summary:
The setRangeText() method of the interface replaces a
range of text in an textarea element with new text passed as the argument.

remarks.para: Additional optional parameters include the start of the section of text to change, the end of the section, and a keyword defining what part of the <textarea> should be selected after the text is updated. If the startSelection and endSelection arguments are not provided, the range is assumed to be the selection.

The final argument determines how the selection will be set after the text has been replaced. The possible values are "select", which selects the newly inserted text, "start", which moves the selection to just before the inserted text, "end", which moves the selection to just after the inserted text, or the default, "preserve", which tries to preserve the selection.
In addition, the and events are fired.
